intro: Haemadictyon marginatum, commonly known as the marginate nettle, is a flowering plant belonging to the Urticaceae family. It is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves with a distinctive red or purple margin. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on slender, hairy stalks. Its leaves are covered in fine hairs that can cause skin irritation upon contact. Haemadictyon marginatum is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
